title: Not good enough
body: I'm suffering with back pain and phoned this morning to try and get an appointment.  I was number 49 in the queue, so I pressed the number for a call back.  When the call came through my phone only rang twice, so by the time I took it out of my pocket to answer, the caller had ended.  Had to go through the process again (42 in the queue this time, another callback requested).  Caller said there were no appointments today and I couldn't make one for next week during this call because I have to phone back on the day.  What a waste of time.

title: A prompt, efficient service
body: Over the past few months I have had cause to contact the surgery . I have always been treated in a prompt and efficient manner. I have had telephone consultations always on the same day as I telephoned. My most recent experience I had a ten minutes telephone call resulting in a same appointment day consultation with the Doctor. I then treated for my complaint. I have always been treated well by the Hereward Practice. I am sure other less well performing practices could learn form Hereward Practice.

title: Disgusting
body:
Came in to get my 2 year old daughter an appointment for later that day, asked reception if they had a thermometer I could use to check her temp as mine at home wasn't working. 
Rude reception staff huffed, went in to see the doctor/nurse I said "thank you, I'm sorry I won't take up much of your time can you please just check her temp?" Her response was "its my lunch break" I wasn't asking for much, my daughter is 2 and was laying in my arms clearly very unwell and I was extremely worried. Being in a doctors surgery you would think it's a safe place but I definitely didn't feel this. I walked out upset with her response and lack of duty of care her response was "oh my god!" I am really disgusted with my experience and the compassion and care this doctor had was zero.

title: Unreliable
body: I've been going to this doctor since I was 6 (now 28). Over the past year I've been seen by a new doctor a couple of times who doesn't listen to you or review your history but rushes to the first thing she thinks of. After a call with her today I was advised to call reception straight back to book a physio appointment. However reception does not pick up the phone. Every time I call there ends up being a queue of people which only goes down when someone gives up waiting because once the phone starts ringing it just rings and doesn't get picked up.

author: Bid911
title: Husband mother and daughter
body:
My husband was terminally ill; my mother was 101 with severe dementia; my daughter was extremely ill. I felt overwhelmed as I had also just fractured my arm and needed surgery. My surgery was done at the beginning of April 2022. My mother died the following day. My husband died the day after my mother. My daughter then had major surgery ( 4 surgeons and 7hours) , 5 days after my husband died.  
I felt totally overwhelmed but in no situation did I ever encounter poor care. I worked for 50 years as a registered nurse including health visiting and latterly specialising in diabetes nursing. I know poor care when I see it but thankfully I did not.

title: Great medicine & frontline staff but dangerous…
body: Arrived to full reception, too ill to jostle for place in queue. Automated check in not working & poor receptionist doing a valiant job of i) dealing with pt in front of her, ii) breaking off every time a new pt came thru door so they wdnt get bashed to encourage them to come right in iii) back to pt in front of her iv) when finished she then had to patiently explain the magical mystery tour to the btm of lift/stairs. I watched this time & motion insanity, let at least 6 pts in front of me but it was scrambling my autism & making me feel even more ill so i wrote a note to receptionist, slipped it under screen & told her i'd wait round the corner so she cd come & find me when there was a gap. As well as easing the brain frying scene in the absence of a *simple* sign over the door, i hoped it wd i) ease pressure on brilliant receptionist & ii) speed other pts thru who do have time pressures. Sooner/later lovely receptionist came thru & we did whatever. I told her all it needed was a simple sign over the door to save her & colls all that extra work& that I'd like2 speak2someone 2sort that when they had a moment. I reassured her it was not a complaint against her but *for* her & ease this obvious log jam (also a serious h&s egress exit problem). I have worked as a professional in h&s & signage placement on 1st & 2nd floor is positively dangerous in the event of a fire. I had plenty of time it didnt matter where i felt so poorly & safer& nicer for receptionist & pts if receptionists are not having2 continuously explain blocked reception area. Sooner or later someone came along whose grammatically medically evident sex ..she did not invite me to explain my observation she just assumed i was a selfish patient who was complaining for myself, the very *last* thing i was doing, even though i had waited at least 30mins for receptionist to get to me & *chosen* to do that *for* her & *for* other pts. In fact i wanted to suggest a *solution* that would save receptionists work & stress & ease patient throughput (systems engineering was my actual profession) This dear lady launched in to "It's temporary"in fact new building has been live since 19 Feb ie 4 months "You've got to understand only one receptionist". In fact i understood that salient fact very well which was why i was going *out* of my way to *help* everybody *else*. Its almost like this lady thinks all pts are nasty, selfish people but in fact some of us want to give reception staff basic arrangements that some ppl might think were the responsibility of the surgery management. After an autistic meltdown due to this bizarre response (which may be breach of Equality Act 2010: Autism as Id'd by excellent GP at St Ps) a Dr was kind & said come back at 5pm. I came back at 5pm with the relevant sign & some more with the lovely new logo (at my own expense). Lovely receptionist was really happy& agreed (as did others) they no longer had to waste time explaining how to get to the bottom of the stairs/lift.

title: Operative control of discomfort/pain
body:
Colonic endoscopy including removal of polyps has been recorded in the recent national press to involve pain in 75% of cases. 
During two such treatments I felt no discomfort and ,having spent my working life as a Dental Surgeon I recommend treatment at PCH in this department for their gentle operating techniques.

title: excellent care all round
body: my mum came in by ambulance(there in no time) all the staff were amazing.  she has late stage alzheimers. she had so many tests within 2 hours of being there, no waiting around. she was transferred to amu very briefly then b4. Staff here were amazing too!   they  really have such a difficult job on this ward . so Impressed by the dementia passports thank you!

title: Excellent care
body: I just had an excellent service at Liverpool spire. From start to finish, the genuine care put me at ease with all the staff involved at each stage. From reception to, ward staff, aneathatists and most importantly my consultant. He looked after me during surgery, made me feel confident and at total ease. Really lovely man, I can’t thank him enough for carrying out my Laryngoscopy and getting back on the road to recovery with my much needed voice. Thank you

title: Poor practice
body: Recent admission to ED then AMU everyone was generally polite but I noticed staff not wearing aprons when giving personal care on any of wards or departments. I find this concerning as staff go from person to person and only wear gloves, I know we are encouraged to use less plastic but surely this is an infection risk.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Very efficient and well-run practice. Never a problem with getting to speak with the doctors and being assessed.

title: Efficient, friendly practice
body: Staff were friendly and polite, I was not kept waiting very long. The doctor was bright and concise and checked my understanding. She also listened well and addressed my concerns. I felt listened to.

title: Exemplary practice
body: What an amazing practice with such wonderful caring staff who take the time to listen and discuss issues. Our family have been attending the practice for many years and we can't speak highly enough of the wonderful people there.

title: If you can, choose another surgery
body:
Awful service. Unable to even make an appointment without it being referred to the ‘booking team’ who then take up to two weeks to even contact you for an appointment - and that’s for something marked urgent mind you. The team will then give you an appointment. You cannot request an appointment time that might be even the slightest bit convenient for you, you have to work entirely to their schedule. When I questioned this I was told ‘lots of people are in the same situation as you’. Well, yes they would be because I would think most of the population would find it easier to book appointments around their schedule. 

I also needed a physical appointment with a doctor because the ailment I am suffering with needs an actual physical exam - despite this I was given a phone consult. The doctor I talked fo was extremely rude and rushed and told me I need a physical appointment. Which I tried to do in the first place. 

Absolutely infuriating. 

Maybe dropping off this mortal coil would suit them better.

title: Poor empathy or care from treatment staff
body: Fractured foot - nurses were rough unempathetic and frankly the two I got appeared like they didn’t want to be there. They didn’t explain anything just gave me two leaflets and sent me on my way. Unable to walk in hindsight I should have raised a fuss while I was there

title: Great care
body: Went into emergency department last night.  Doctors and nurses were absolutely amazing, so helpful, caring friendly and couldn't do enough for us.

title: Rude
body: After a phone call with a nurse explaining I am 26 weeks pregnant, cannot stop being sick and feel extremely unwell, I asked if I could come in for a urine dip and BP taken. I was told she couldn’t see me until the following week and that I should not ring 111 in the mean time as this would be an ‘inappropriate use of service’. This nurse made me feel very patronised and as made me feel like I was wasting her time and she had better things to be doing than her job.

title: Excellent practice!
body: I am able to get the help I need promptly when I need it an have my questions answered. My GP is knowledgeable, helpful and friendly

title: Excellent practice!
body: I am able to get the help I need promptly when I need it an have my questions answered. My GP is knowledgeable, helpful and friendly

title: Sent me a message saying I had appt date  but no…
body:
Why send a text saying you have an appt at x on x date only to not but the time ? No way to get in touch just an email to cancel ? 
Not good

title: I’m worried
body:
I have always recommended Concord due to their superb response to ask my GP enquires. (Usually same day). They even maintained this standard whist rolling out covid vaccines. 
I don’t know what has happened to them lately, they have really fallen short of this standard. I had no response for 3 days and had to call to ask for an emergency appointment as I was so Ill. 
My daughter is currently experiencing the same problem, she is quite poorly. Contacted surgery 3 days ago, nothing and it’s now the weekend. This is inexplicable as I fail to understand what has changed so much. Please address this Concord you are letting your high standards slip.

title: repeat prescriptions
body: Getting my repeat prescription in time was always a huge effort but last time it was simply traumatic. I am an old woman living alone and suffering from depression. The doctor`s attitude left me feeling like an old rubbish that is not worth listening to. I am left without my sleeping pills.

title: Very friendly practice
body:
I always feel at ease when seeing the Dr, who listens to me and doesn't push me,
I feel very confident with what he says and suggests. More than happy with this practice. Also the reception staff are very polite and friendly.

title: Thoughtful and responsive
body:
I came to my first session with what I think were called moderate to severe symptoms of anxiety and low mood. My therapist took her time to get to know me and my main issues.  She introduced me to several tools which I introduced into my weekly living. 

A particular breakthrough for me came when she clarified for me the different presentations of worry, rumination and low mood - the three were so intertwined for me that I found it hard to describe what I was feeling and which tool to use.

I have learned through the direction she provided about the importance of practice - of regularly using the techniques she taught me. 

The booklet I was given describing some of the techniques was very helpful, and I still have and use it.

My treatment took place as the days were getting lighter, something that has always helped lift my mood. The test of how well I have engaged with what I have been given, will I think come in the autumn as days get noticeably shorter.

I would like to thank my therapist for her support - it really has made a difference.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: be careful
body:
medical review to dvla reference shall we say errors in statements made by certain from individuals , have to be careful what i review as i have previously been asked to leave the practice if not happy with the service
must say though a lot of the staff are caring and professional .
keep a record if possible of your experience be wary

title: Terrible aftercare
body: The ward staff and physios on the wards are arrogant, rude and totally uncaring and will not listen to valid concerns. Its all about getting rid of people even of they place them in a position where they are likely to be returned to hospital. Many staff do not speak adequate English in order to properly communicate with patients who have hearing and sight impairment. Total lack of communication between different departments and other hospitals resulting in poor care and frustrated carers.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb service
body:
Very efficient & friendly service. Listened carefully to my concerns, resulting in a follow up appointment with a specialist to help diagnose the root cause of my condition. Was kept informed of the actions being taken via a text from the surgery, received within 30 mins of my visit.
First class service

title: No way to run a medical practice
body: I tried ringing the practice on 12 June simply to change my appointment for my annual review with the nurse. I have just received my telephone bill and discovered that I was on the phone for 69 minutes and 8 seconds at a cost of £19.12. This one phone call for a simple request represents one third of my quarterly phone bill, and the practice believes they are doing a good job. This is not a good way to run a business.

title: The worst surgery ever
body: I been with this sugery for so long. That I have only been do get seen to like 5 times since I have been there. To get an appointment it's a joke. When u go there there no one in the waiting area. My doctors is useless it took over a year for her to send my daughter to the hospital to get seen to as she didn't know what do do with her. To the fact my daughter seen was showing pink flesh. She turn around and said yes that it bad. I have asked for meds and I only get one of the item I have asked for when I have asked for 6 of them. I will be changing my doctors as they are sooo useless.

title: Great service
body:
I really needed to see a GP as advised by my local pharmacist to get advise. I went to GP hub the receptionist did say that I heeded make App throughhe NHS 11 1 but when she saw thae state of my allergies  she gave me Appointment for same day 
I was able to see Doctor who prescribed medication for me

title: Worst place ever
body: No regards for people who work full time spent 3 weeks trying to get through on phone over 30 in que getting told off from boss for being on my phone while at work every time I get through told no appointments left.  So called later on in day finally get through to be told have to ring on day for appointments full time people can't just take time off like that for routine appointments your shifts are your shifts ridiculous... everywhere priorities the ones that don't earn a living and pay their taxes and national insurance

title: Excellent care
body: I had a molar removed at the Homerton today and was impressed by the high level of care I received from every member of staff I encountered. They all communicated clearly to me what would happen and were warm and human and reassuring in their communication style. I’ve been coming to the Homerton for over twenty years and I’ve noticed a massive improvement in how the staff interact with patients in the last few years. Thank you so much.

title: Great practice
body:
Staff were polite and understanding in a very stressful situation.
Treatment was well explained and carried out.  Thank you all for your kindness and expertise. You are a credit to the NHS. I shall be singing your praises  in Scotland.

title: Great Service
body:
I want to the walk in center at Oakham Hospital ran by Oakham MP and and I want to say a massive thank you.

I turned up on the day no appointment spoke the the gentleman on reception and he booked me in. I only waited 5mins till I was seen.

A new doctor who has only been there 6 weeks was amazing. He prescribed me medication sent it over and it was ready for me straight away. 
 The doctor examined my wrist did some tests , informed me of a physio app and got a wrist support. He was so helpful and very knowledgeable. I can’t remember his name but want to do a massive thank you.

title: Good experience
body:
Recently I had a cause to make an appointment, these have been face to face and phone.
They have been very understanding and dealing with my illness,  and reassuring. I have had tests done and medication given appropriately. 
I am very happy with the service I have had.
Have to ring exactly at 8am to get an appointment otherwise they get full very quickly.

title: Failure of triage by photographic evidence
body:
Requested to see nurse regarding post operation query/assurance.
Photo evidence sent for assessment.
Told to return to hospital in Harrow as surgical drain required. Spent several hours waiting with concern after this diagnosis.
Endured over two hours round trip in car ( I had knee replacement). Only to be told everything was normal and no treatment was required.
This system is obviously not fit for purpose in all occasions.
Maybe you could review and amended.
Barry Simmons

title: Incompetent Surgery
body: Had a blood test for a suspected dvt. Doctor phoned me in the evening and left a vm asking me to call him to discuss test results. No number left for me to call back on. Rang 111 who told me that the test was never carried out, mistake was made on the form. Went back to surgery for another blood test. Was called by GP the following day to say the nurse hadn't taken enough blood. Had to go back again to have blood taken. Doctor phoned me on Friday night to say I had test positive for a suspected dvt and was prescribing heparin injection and was unable to book me in for a scan until Monday. Today, Saturday, tried 8 pharmacies, none of them stock heparin injections. I have just been left like this and dvt is a very serious condiiton to have - life threatening.

title: Managing waiting
body: We had to wait 2 1/2 hours before anything happened. My partner was whisked away and we sat apart for most of that time until I asked a nurse if we could wait together. Please allow patients the option to sit with family before their procedure if possible, as this reduces stress. Often waiting is the hardest part.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unfair to another patient
body:
I turned up at 10.20 for my 10.30 appointment with the nurse. I didn’t get to see her until 11.00. Another patient came in she was 10 mins late, after getting stuck behind a broken down lorry in Calne, I also got stuck behind this lorry for a short while. This poor lady was told she was too late and would have to have another appointment. It was so frustrating for her, knowing how difficult it is to get any appointments, let alone, the wait on the phone just to speak to someone.
So she was 10 mins late for her appointment and I was 30 mins late getting into see the nurse, where is the fairness, and compassion !!!!

title: Great care
body: I attended the walk in with a minor injury to my eye which was causing me a lot of pain. All staff were courteous, professional and calming. Each person dealt with me swiftly and with great care. Thanks for a great service all. A truly wonderful asset to the community which allowed me to continue with my working day.

title: Outstanding service
body: I'd like to thank you for recent outstanding service in getting an urgent delivery to me in less than 24 hours

title: Not fit for purpose
body:
Ridiculous situation where the operator would not (could not) discuss notes of previous call. Follow on from the same issues which I need additional help with. Not their fault personally I am sure no doubt its 'the process.' Well the process is clearly not fit for purpose. 

Can't get a go appointment.  NHS consult closed at the weekend and NHS 111 won't  deal with it. 

It encourages people to tell a pack of lies to get referred or they go to A&E and for older, honest people (like me) it's  very difficult and puts my health at risk.

title: Everything fine
body: On-time and prompt  walked straight in and straight to see doctor. No need to wait or anything like that

title: Paediatrics - emergency, so kind and efficient
body: I visited early this morning with my 3 year old granddaughter for whom I was caring this weekend.  They were so kind to us - extremely thorough in their diagnosis and gave immediate treatment and reassurance.  It was topped off with my little one receiving a teddy donated to the hospital.  Exemplary service, thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Happy with the service I received and hopefully won’t have to wait long for physio that I have been told I need

title: Warm, friendly and extremely skilful treatment
body:
I had a very positive experience at Barnet yesterday, where I was referred to have my facial injury attended to. In particular, the doctor who did most of the work on me took time to be friendly (even though they must have had a very busy schedule), put me at ease and explain what going to be done. They managed an intricate and time-consuming procedure with great patience and sensitivity. I feel extremely fortunate to have benefited from their skills.
All the staff were similarly welcoming, and the hospital maintains this atmosphere throughout. It made for me what might have been a  stressful experience very reassuring, knowing I was getting the best possible attention.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Two issues two referrals sorted.
body: I had two medical issues and within 10 minutes the doctor agreed to refer me to two specialists. When he examined my injury he quickly realised what was wrong.

title: Excellent care.
body: I traveled from Colchester to Chelmsford fearing the worst, however upon arrival I was met by friendly staff and booked in and offered refreshment. When my turn came I was collected and taken through for my operation and was treated with care at every step of the way. I can only thank the staff for what I thought was going to be painful but turned out to be anything but. I will now wait for my follow up appointment. Certainly 5 star treatment.

title: Amazing Treatment
body: Today my Mom was taken into hospital after a fall. She was put in the Ada ward where the staff are part of the ambulance team. What an amazing ward that is. Moms treatment was second to non and all the staff were exceptional. Thank you so much for the care you showed my Mom.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Everyone at this Practice is always very helpful. They take time to listen to your ailments, prescribe medication if needed or request further tests and refer to a specialist if necessary.

title: Surprisingly good
body: From entering accident and Emergency to discharge the experience, the quality of the staff,doctors, nurses and the treatment was extraordinarily good.

title: Great practice
body:
Very satisfied, my queries were answered well and I have confidence in the GP
I had an appointment that was convenient and easy to book

title: Responsive and caring
body: An engaged, caring and genuinely attentive medic who responded with tact and sensitivity to my anxiety. Left feeling informed and reassured

title: Helpful practice
body:
The clinician listened attentively to my description of my symptoms and advised me of possible treatment. 
He even discussed a different ailment to the main issue and advised on that also.
Very happy with the service.

title: Brilliant Service
body:
I have had a truly great day today as a day case. From being checked in, preoperative processes, theatre staff, post op care staff , all superb, really friendly and patient. Every step was explained, could see how well they were working as a team. My personal treatment was Brilliant,   who said the NHS is broke...long may it live. 
A huge thank you.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Efficient service and staff friendly and hard working, practice very easy location. I had a nice experience there. Thanks

title: Excellent care
body: I would just like to say a massive thank you for everything you did for me on the 22nd June, you really did save my life.  Thank you for the care , reassurance and help you provided. Everyone involved in treating me and helping me were amazing. I know you don't get the credit and thanks you deserve. Once again thank you. Everyone from the reception team, nurses, and ENT department were first class with the treatment and service provided.

title: Great practice
body: I have just watched a video on how the coil is inserted and in the comments alot of women where saying about horrible experiences, so I just wanted to say thank you to the nurses that fitted my they where so kind and reassuring and made me feel comfortable with such a private area that could make any women feel uncomfortable to have that done. Also it made me think, and every time I've been for me or my daughter we have always been delt with with care and consideration and ways mad me feel comfortable and happy. So thank you. Xx

title: I am indebted to them
body: I recently suffered a massive heart attack and was rushed to Worcester hospital where I was taken straight into theatre where All the staff were ready waiting to save my life, they were so efficient and caring at what they did. Transfered to Aconbury ward 2 first then onto Aconbury 1 for recovery. Again I can't say enough on how good and caring All the staff, nurses, cleaners, doctors, helpers etc they have all been beyond fantastic. Thank you Worcester Hospital I am indebted to all of you.

title: Fantastic practice
body: :  My daughter has had bloods since she was born due to having a under active thyroid. Every time has been traumatic. The first time having the done at the practice and not at home or hospital the nurse made her feel valued, and supported and relaxed. She let her take the bloods twice. I am so pleased with the support from booking by receptionist advice from the doctor to taking her bloods. Outstanding practice x

title: Exceptional service
body:
I was in a&e today, from checking in at reception to being discharged, the nurses, doctors an consultants were amazing, really friendly, they couldn't do enough, I am so pleased with the way they cared for me, I think they do a amazing job, they don't get enough credit for the long hours an hard work they do, 
Respect to them all.

title: Great care
body:
I was admitted to Howard ward on Thursday 21 June and wanted to say the staff who were working very hard, had time to speak to people they cared for on bay 5, I found all staff responsive to request around all my care, they ensured best practice and quality care was given, and made me feel comfortable at all times,
Thank you to cleaning staff who kept all the ward spotless and enjoyable to be on, very friendly and happy nurses and support workers

title: Good practice
body: Got appointment same day as I received the letter inviting me to attend. Went in the evening it was not busy staff were very polite and the practice was very well appointed. Would highly recommend this service.

title: Fantastic doctors
body: I have been under the Friargate practice for many years and have always had a brilliant service by kind, knowledgeable and supportive doctors. I use the website for queries and it’s always responded to quickly. The doctors have phoned me numerous times to discuss my queries and are consistently brilliant. I can’t praise the doctors highly enough. Thank you for so many reasons.

title: Great practice
body: The staff at the practice were very professional polite and friendly, wouldn’t hesitate at having to go back if necessary.

title: Nice people
body:
I recently came for a MRI scan, my first. The nursing staff were welcoming, explained the procedure carefully and ensured I had no concerns. Everything went as it should have and I was soon on my way. 
Nice people doing a good job. What more can you ask?
Thank you.

Robin Church

title: Brilliant
body: I called in with an issue and was told initially that they couldn’t deal with it. I was expecting, therefore, to go to the QA A&E in great discomfort. Fortunately the nurse I saw was able to work around the problem leaving the issue fully resolved. Thank you so much for the care I received.

title: Ocean suite
body: Thank you to all the staff on ocean suite for looking after me. The ward is so clean and the nurse's are so caring. You all made my stay comfortable xx

title: Excellent
body: Good friendly receptionist. Excellent doctor very helpful and reassuring. As always a good service provided at Patford House.

title: Excellent service
body: I had cause to contact the GP about a small funding application I was making that needed their input. The call I received from the GP, was both on time and very understanding. In addition, the follow-up made by the GP was extremely efficient and the matter was dealt with, within a day of my contacting them. Outstanding. Thank you for the help.

title: Understanding
body:
The staff at Stoke ( Newcastle) were very helpful and sympathetic 
They explained everything clearly, I took the medicine as given home and the procedure was as given on the instructions. 
4 days later I’m nearly back to full strength

title: Better than new
body: I make a point of never leaving reviews, but felt so strongly about this that I’ve made an exception. I arrived on Ward 44 with suspected pneumonia and left exactly a week later, not only recovered, but healthier than I’ve been in years, with a new toolbox of tricks to stay that way! Every single member of staff on the ward was friendly, caring, compassionate and professional. I saw them caring for everyone in my ward in the same way and I cannot praise them highly enough. No matter how busy they were, they always tried their hardest to accommodate everyone’s needs, with dignity, as soon as they could. An amazing team of people. Thank you all so much.

title: Great practice
body: Good doctors and nurses always ready to. Listen i reccomend this practice and the recponists work hard to get you appinments they do. There best

title: Excellent clinic
body: Excellent service from a wonderful team, from beginning to end. The care I received made my visit to have my operation a wonderful experience, and I had a gift my new eye. Over the moon thanks to all.

title: Excellent practice
body:
Very caring and helpful. 
The surgery is very convenient and close to where I live so I am very happy with all the staff.

title: Brilliant
body:
I wish to leave a review for the CCU bay on  Bolton Ward and the Cardiology/ Pacemaker departments,
I was admitted as an emergency late afternoon  from A&E on Monday  12/6/23 suffering from breathlessness . The care I received in this unit was fantastic, everything explained to me as events took place.from , the machinery I was hooked up to, to the procedure that would help me. The consultant,  saw me on Tuesday morning and explained I needed a pacemaker which he would insert on Wednesday morning. 
I was then visited by the pacemaker team, shown the  device and the procedure explained. Following the procedure I immediately felt the benefit.
I was discharged on Thursday.  What  a brilliant team and result for me!!

title: Superb   service
body: Needing attention to a badly cut forearm, I needed three visits to the MIU. The treatment I received was extremely quick, and the follow up appointments were very punctual. Centre staff were  all very personable and efficient,giving a first class impression of the facility. All round excellence.

title: Brilliant GP service around Telford
body: I cannot praise this surgery enough, from front line staff to GP's and nurses. Everyone one here is very kind, caring, polite and extremely professional. They give you ample time, listen to your problem and they do their best put you at ease and explain everything carefully. Thank you all for providing such a good service, you all are wonderful.

title: Great care and support
body: I have received the best possible care and support from this young Doctor over the past couple of months.  For which I am very grateful and I consider him to be a very valuable addition to this Practice,

title: Friendly staff
body: Really calm visit today, seen on time and was a lovely practitioner. Staff answer phone calls and get seen quickly.

title: Got worse
body:
I have used fittleworths for nearly 4 yrs and they used to be really good.However lately they seem to be struggling.wrong orders,missing items ( they blame my gp),2 weeks to deliver,hardly any dry wipes(they blame nhs guidelines)no answer from the assigned stoma nurse.
They really need to get their act together.

title: Excellant Service
body: Attended late Saturday following severe pain. Diagnosed problem and explained fully (renal colic). No waiting very good service. Thankyou.

title: Great team providing excellent care
body: We had the experience of an unwell child, went to GP who immediately recommended hospitalisation. Went up to the hospital, welcomed into the ward and the team there immediately checked our child, nursing team then doctors. Nursing team were caring, conscientious, helpful and kind. The doctors were great saw him on arrival and each morning. Explained things well and clearly despite the challenge of understanding the symptoms. The support given made a difficult time easier whether providing cups of tea or cleaning the room to the more challenging problem of assessing the cause of the problem our child had. Bye the bye, a great play room.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly and efficient practice
body: Always receive a fast response (typically same day mostly within an hour or so of submitting an econsult.) Reception are friendly and knowledgeable and the doctors and nurses are friendly, caring and show genuine interest and concern

title: Complete and utter rubbish
body: Can never get an appointment, reception staff are so rude and just keep referring to 111. A lot of management issues, I don’t know how this Pratice continues to run, failing the local community it’s supposed to serve, all funding should be withdrawn, think the CQC needs to come in and take over services urgently.

title: Para medic practitioner excellent
body: Great communication, let me know what to expect and when. And it happened as he said it would.  Would recommend

title: Excellent caring
body: My mother in law was admitted to Hembury ward this month and the care was exceptional my mother in law and my family wish to thank them

title: Positive experience may it continue
body: Having arrived through A&E then admitted to ward 14 then onto ward 30 my experience was extremely positive, the care from the nurses and doctors was in my experience the best I’ve received having had my 4th hospital admission this year I had some issues previously but felt that this time I was really looked after so well always on top of my pain relief and the medications I needed,from surgery procedure to discharge. Please send me gratitude to all the staff within this department and wards they all did an amazing job when the department was very overwhelmed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Horrendous waiting time
body: On our last visit we have waited 40mins over the appointment time. I understand that things don't always go by plan, but some consideration to others lifes would be nice. The appointment was for 1 year old, who is on schedule and was absolutely unbareble for the rest of the day and night. We all make time in the day to fit with appointments and then this happens. If we were 5mins late our appointment would be canceled, but we can wait 40mins. Shocking. I would have rather wait extra day or two to get the appointment then trying to squeeze things in this cost.

title: Disappointing experience
body:
Overly long pre recorded telephone message states that you can now book appointments using the NHS app. This is incorrect as there are no appointments available to book at this surgery. Why not? 
The website is difficult to navigate, contains out of date information and does not allow feedback from patients about how to improve services. It is not possible to directly message this surgery.

title: Amazing
body: Can't praise the treatment I recieved here enough from consultant to surgeon to nurses theatre staff and reception team all the most helpful,caring team fantastic and thank you all

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Terrible Culture . Locums can be the most helpful
body: The GP partners make no attempt to follow up on discharge letters from the local hospital. My history is simply made up in hospital referrals.  Wild inaccuracies written in referrals to the hospital feel like it's being made up and also including incorrect factual information.  The culture is careless and slapdash.  Some of the GP partners appear to have an attitude problem.  They will ignore reasonable appropriate questions for days.  Feels unsafe and the attitude can be very off. They simply want to argue over everything instead of helping . Chaotic and hostile culture.  Always hoping for a locum appointment over the actual go partners who generally want to help and will make accurate records at least. Avoid the practice doctors if you can and hope for a remote locum not stuck in the bad culture of this terrible practice. They are bothered at all about mistakes in notes. Bad leadership . Office and administration staff some can be shockingly rude occasionally helpful but not often.

title: Positive first impressions
body:
A couple of weeks ago  I decided to investigate changing to a different surgery as I was becoming increasingly disillusioned by the one I have been  registered with since 2007.  Two friends recommended Bedwell Surgery as being a caring, friendly Practice.  I registered on Thursday 8th June.  The receptionist was polite, friendly, and informative. She made me feel welcome straight away. I was given an appointment for a Health Check on Wednesday 14th June with a nurse.  

The nurse was again, polite, friendly, caring and informative.  My BP was rather high so she suggested I checked it at home later on and call the surgery with the numbers later.  When I eventually founded my BP monitor, it was too late in the day to phone.  After 2 readings, last night and this morning, I decided to see if I might be lucky to have an appointment with a doctor today. I was phoned at 09.02 by a very pleasant doctor.   Not only did we sort out a 7 day monitoring of my BP but after a short discussion about my general health, it was suggested I see the MSK practitioner and an appointment was made for Tuesday 27th June.

I should like to thank everyone I've spoken to so far for their friendly, caring manner, for listening to me and for making me feel like a human being again instead of just a  statistic.

title: Fantastic practice
body: It was calming atmosphere people were kind, friendly and professional. I definitely love to go back there if I needed more test in future.

title: No human contact
body: I fell getting out of bed at 2am and hit my forehead on the corner of the radiator.  I had a nasty gash which my husband said needed a stitch so we went to St Richards A&E where I had to fill in a lot of irrelevant questions on a screen.  After nearly half an hour not a single person sitting waiting had had any interaction with an NHS staff member.  I decided that rather than waiting forever, I would get my husband to try to tape my gash together at home.  I think instead of paying people to sit behind a screen and relying on technology to do their work, the NHS needs to use their receptionist to interact with the people in the waiting room advising them what is happening and how long it is likely to be before they will be seen by a medic.  Not impressed with St Richards use of technology while the receptionist is left to chat to colleagues instead of interacting with their patients.  By the way most of the screens seemed to be out of order, but fortunately I was the only person who had to use one at that moment.  Sad situation thinking that machines can replace human interaction.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointment for  pain help
body:
Having ecpriemced more pain than normal in  lower back leg , bearable  given some tablets that now nothing in the painkillers wont work for long times no effects
Ankle.  Refered by  doctor to physo department. Stoll waiting for MRI to see if tgere is another reason.7 months.received a  text asking me did i still.need an apppintment!!!! Very badly organised department..fpr my age group..doctors asked urgent. but she was igrored...and i am Ignorded.. want an appointment

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Asthma Reviews Feedback
body:
At the request of the practice I recently completed on an online asthma control test, scoring 25/25 which show that my asthma is well controlled (within the last 4 weeks). I was asked to make a face-to-face appointment for an annual asthma review where I was asked the same questions that I was answered in the online questionnaire. I asked if the review could have been completed as a telephone appointment, the answer was yes as I have my own peak flow meter. Some feedback:
- send patients a text confirmation of their appointments
- offer patients telephone appointments where possible
-  I prefer the plan sent as an SMS attachment. Don't print the plan unless this is what the patient prefers.  

Thank you

title: Brilliant practice
body: Old Courthouse is an excellent surgery, with wonderful staff. The doctors and nurses are knowledgable and professional but also sympathetic and friendly. It's very efficiently run in terms of getting appointments, prescriptions and referrals. Recently, I had a phone consultation for knee pain. Very quickly I was sent a link to book an MRI scan which I had within the week. I have already had the results explained to me by both a physio and a doctor at the surgery and have now been referred to hospital for further treatment. I'm impressed!

title: I’m making great progress towards my goals
body: I had 12 weeks of in person CBT earlier this year for social anxiety. I found it to be incredibly useful and insightful. There was even a fair amount of CBT done out in the community which was a great learning experience and broke down many negative beliefs I had about myself and others. I have gained an awareness of what’s going on and I feel like I’m making great progress towards my aims. Thank you iCope.

title: Worst team of professionals
body: My child has been booked an appointment at 10:50am Sunday. We turned up on time and reported in the reception but it took more then 1 hour for them to see him. All i saw was the staff are giggling away in jokes inside the doctors area. The doctor saw the 1st patient after 25/30 mins of our reported time. What was worst that i told the receptionist the child got behavioural issue. If the doctor can't see the patients on time why they give such appointments?
